intro: Floscaldasia, commonly known as the flame orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, brightly colored flowers that resemble flames, typically in shades of red and orange. The plant belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is known for its intricate floral structure. Floscaldasia thrives in humid, warm environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
